review_text: Nestled in the woods and farmland of Southwest Ohio, just northwest of Springfield, this hidden gem of a cottage was a wonderful place for my wife and I to stay for a much-needed weekend getaway from everyday stress and worry. The latter is not a word you would use when you reserve a day or two at Lisa's place, as she has taken care of "everything" from check-in to check-out - amenities and thoughtful touches are included, so that all you need are transportation, change of clothes, hiking boots, primary ingredients for meals (all the other accompaniments like spices, snacks, and supplies are found in the well-stocked kitchen), and a good book to read in front of the fireplace. The first thing we noticed after we drove along a cute little lane and pulled up to the cottage was how quiet and serene the setting was - the birds singing and lack of any discernable traffic drone helped usher in a peaceful feeling. After that, you'll discover a cozy, family-of-four-sized cottage to call your own - surrounded by lots of scenic woods, trails, gardens, and a fish-stocked pond directly across from the front porch. review_text: The unit is not “new construction” but it is tidy and well appointed. Plenty of storage, soft sheets and clean towels. The entrance is in the attached garage down 12 steep and dimly lit stairs. There is no way to lock the unit from the outside so don’t bring your most prized possessions. The vinyl plank floors are buckling from moisture under the slab which would be a bummer if you’re bringing a baby. The pond is in the middle of the pasture with the calves, goats and herd watchdogs. Our German Shepherd was attacked by Janie the watchdog after entering the pasture. After I informed the owners they came down to check on her. The driveway is ruled by two tiny chihuahuas that will run towards an approaching vehicle. The kids were excited to use the slip-and-slide advertised but it is no longer available. My son enjoyed chasing the chickens and my daughter was amazed that they really do lay eggs! If you’re a light sleeper remember that it’s a basement and the owners bedroom/bathroom is right above where you’ll be sleeping. They do have cable and wifi but don’t expect to use your cellphone in the unit. We ordered pizza from Short Stop one night, it was pretty tasty and they deliver! I don’t think this is a great vacation destination like I had hoped, but it would make a good pit stop. Great value for the amount of square footage. Check-in and check-out was very easy, the owner even let us have an extra hour to get out the door.
